falseFriends.example: Estou constipado, tenho o nariz entupido.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I have a cold, my nose is blocked.
falseFriends.tip: In Portugal, constipação is just a runny nose — nothing to do with your stomach!

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: That man is very strange.
falseFriends.tip: Esquisito in Portuguese means the opposite of fancy — it means weird!

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: Pull the door to open.
falseFriends.tip: PUXAR = PULL. Every door in Portugal will test you on this.

falseFriends.example: Ela ficou embaraçada com a situação.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: She was embarrassed by the situation.
falseFriends.tip: Embaraçada means embarrassed in PT. The confusion is that in Spanish, embarazada means pregnant — but not in Portuguese! Grávida = pregnant.

falseFriends.example: Vou assistir ao jogo de futebol.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I'm going to watch the football match.
falseFriends.tip: Assistir = to watch. If you want help, you need ajudar.

falseFriends.example: Pretendo ir a Lisboa no verão.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I intend to go to Lisbon in the summer.
falseFriends.tip: Pretender = to plan. Fingir = to pretend. Don't mix them up!

falseFriends.example: Ela é muito sensível, chora facilmente.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: She's very sensitive, she cries easily.
falseFriends.tip: Sensível = sensitive (emotional). Sensato = sensible (logical).

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I have many relatives in the Algarve.
falseFriends.tip: Parentes = relatives (the whole family). Pais = parents (mum and dad).

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I bought this book at the bookshop.
falseFriends.tip: Livraria = you buy books. Biblioteca = you borrow books.

falseFriends.actualMeaning: to carry out / to achieve / to accomplish
falseFriends.example: Vamos realizar o projeto este mês.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: We're going to carry out the project this month.
falseFriends.tip: Realizar = to make something happen. Aperceber-se = to become aware.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I have an appointment at three.
falseFriends.tip: Compromisso = you have somewhere to be. Acordo = meeting in the middle.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I put the documents in the folder.
falseFriends.tip: Pasta = folder or paste (pasta de dentes = toothpaste). Massa = the food you eat.

falseFriends.example: Não me recordo do nome dele.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I don't remember his name.
falseFriends.tip: Recordar = to recall a memory. Gravar = to press the record button.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: What a polite young man!
falseFriends.tip: Educado = good manners. Instruído = book-smart.

falseFriends.example: Há uma eventual mudança de horário.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: There's a possible schedule change.
falseFriends.tip: Eventual = maybe it happens. In English, eventual = definitely happens later.

falseFriends.example: O meu avô trabalhou naquela fábrica.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: My grandfather worked in that factory.
falseFriends.tip: Fábrica = factory (where things are fabricated). Tecido = the material.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I saw the news on the evening news.
falseFriends.tip: Notícia = news story. Aviso = a sign or warning.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: Currently I live in Lisbon.
falseFriends.tip: Atualmente = right now, these days. Na verdade = actually, in truth.

falseFriends.example: Ela tem um cargo importante na empresa.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: She has an important position in the company.
falseFriends.tip: Cargo = your role at work. Carga = stuff being shipped.

falseFriends.example: Quero um pão com presunto, faz favor.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I'd like a bread roll with cured ham, please.
falseFriends.tip: Presunto = delicious ham. Think of the Italian prosciutto — same root!

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: University tuition fees have increased.
falseFriends.tip: Propina = uni fees. Gorjeta = the tip you leave at a restaurant.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: That kid is very clever.
falseFriends.tip: Esperto = street-smart or naturally clever. Perito = a qualified expert.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: The film was very successful.
falseFriends.tip: Êxito = success. Saída = the way out.

falseFriends.example: O Largo do Carmo é muito bonito.
falseFriends.exampleTranslation: Carmo Square is very beautiful.
falseFriends.tip: Largo = wide, or a town square. Grande = big/large.

falseFriends.exampleTranslation: I got food poisoning after dinner.
falseFriends.tip: Intoxicado = bad food, sick stomach. Bêbado = too much vinho verde.
